Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Excel Modeler (Sales and Operations Planning, SQL & Tableau)

Location: Santa Clara (Hybrid)

Duration: 12+ Months




Overview: We are seeking a skilled Excel Modeler with experience in Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP), SQL, and Tableau to join our team on a contract basis. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, excellent modeling skills, and a deep understanding of S&OP processes, SQL databases, and planning functions.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain complex Excel models for forecasting, planning, and analysis.

Automate data processing and reporting tasks using advanced Excel functions and VBA.

Create dynamic dashboards and visualizations to support decision-making processes.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data for S&OP processes.

Develop models to support demand forecasting, inventory planning, and forecasting.

Assist in the creation of S&OP meeting materials, including data analysis and presentation preparation.

Write and optimize SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases.

Integrate SQL data with Excel models and Tableau to ensure accurate and up-to-date reporting.

Assist in the maintenance and improvement of SQL databases to support business needs.

Develop Tableau dashboards to visualize complex data sets and support FP&A activities (nice to have).

Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various reporting tools and platforms.

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver actionable insights.

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Prepare and present detailed reports and recommendations to stakeholders.

Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from various departments.




Experience:

Proven experience as an Excel Modeler or Analyst with a focus on S&OP.

Strong SQL skills with the ability to write complex queries and work with large datasets.

Experience with Tableau for data visualization and reporting.

Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) is a plus.

Advanced proficiency in Excel, including functions, pivot tables, and VBA.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.

Proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and dashboard creation.

Familiarity with S&OP processes and best practices.

Experience with creating data models in Excel using Access and BigQuery.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) is a plus.

Knowledge of statistical analysis and forecasting methods.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Ontario Health, we are committed to developing a strong organizational culture that connects and inspires all team members across the province. Our vision is that together, we will be a leader in health and wellness for all. Our mission is to connect the health system to drive improved and equitable health outcomes, experiences and value. How we work together is reflected through our five values: integrity, inspiration, tenacity, humility and care.

What Ontario Health Offers

Achieving your career goals is a priority to us. Benefits of working at Ontario Health may include the following based on employment type:


Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage from your first day
Health care spending account
Premium defined benefit pension plan
3 personal days and 2 float days annually
Individual contributors start at 3 weeks’ vacation, and 4 weeks at 2 years
Career development opportunities
A collaborative values-based team culture
Wellness programs
A hybrid working model
Participation in Communities of Inclusion


Want to make a difference in your career?  Consider this opportunity.

The Data Analyst performs a key function in supporting data integrity of identity management services to the healthcare sector on behalf of the Enterprise Data Management portfolio, responsible for the data quality and integrity of data contributed to the provincial EHR data assets. The Data Analyst role is specifically responsible for the data integrity reviews of Admission, Discharge and Transfer (ADT) data contributed to the Provincial Client Registry (PCR / EMPI), as well as reviews of the provider data contributed to the Provincial Provider Registry (PPR).

Here Is What You Will Be Doing


Acts as the primary contact to assigned data sources who contribute to the Patient and Provider Registries (PCR and PPR), such as hospital Health Records Departments and RHPA Colleges, to support data quality and data integrity related error remediation of Personal Information/Personal Health Information (PHI) related records.
Analyzes inbound records against existing records in the PCR and PPR, and manually performs health record set linking, unlinking, and merging functions of records submitted.
Manages relationships with Record Management contacts at the data sources and supports Health or Registration record staff in resolving data integrity related tasks and monitors hospital progress in reducing data integrity task queues.
Provides overviews and training to hospital health record and college department staff who will be leveraging the PCR and PPR ‘Inspector’ tool, used by data sources for viewing their data integrity tasks and issues.
Works with data sources to further investigate and resolve complex health record overlays and duplicate patient or record situations, where the data source requires additional support for patient unmerges or patient overwrite situations in their own local system, as well as to ensure that the correction is applied in the PCR/PPR.
Works with the team to ensure work coverage and tasks are completed as a team effort.
Maintains ownership of assigned tasks, tickets and reports, and ensures the timely completion and conclusion of each until resolution.
Accountable for service quality for their data source (assigned client), and assurance of data quality and integrity in the PCR/PPR, as these registries are used for supporting the Electronic Health Record overall.
Fosters sustainable, trusted relationships with team members, data sources, and superiors.
Acts as subject matter expert on data source record accuracy.
Identifies and escalates issues, working with the team/colleagues and leadership, as well as external data sources/clients to ensure adherence to data quality and integrity standards.
Contributes to recommendations brought forward by Senior DIA's based on data integrity and record observations and supports the execution of new or enhanced data quality analysis or reporting.
Engages in Data Quality and Integrity related activities and reporting and recommends process efficiencies to improve the team function and knowledge. Suggests improvements to increase data quality oversight and reduce the volume of data quality affected records.
Makes key decisions on patient record linking after conducting analysis of the inbound record against existing records.
Maintains confidentiality and data/system integrity to mitigate privacy incidents or breaches that could result in patient safety concerns.


Here Is What You Will Need To Be Successful

Education and Experience


College diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Health Information Management.
Canadian Health Information Management Association (CHIMA) designation is an asset.
2 years of experience working within a Healthcare environment such as a hospital is preferred, or equivalent health care organization or agency.
1-3 years of health information management experience.
Experience working with personal health information (PHI), and understanding the importance of protection, privacy and security of all records submitted to Ontario Health.
Knowledge of health information management systems.
Knowledge of Legislative boundaries and privacy regulations unique to Ontario and Canada.
Knowledge of Patient safety considerations.


Knowledge and Skills


Ability to apply privacy and security expectations on the handling of PHI.
Ability to apply health information management skills and analysis on PHI records.
Ability to apply data analysis skills on the review of patient identity record information.
Ability to apply client relationships skills in managing relationships with key contacts at the data sources (hospitals, colleges, etc.).
Ability to apply decision making skills related to the accuracy and integrity of data records coming into the registries, and confidently linking or associating the records against the correct patient or provider.
Ability to demonstrate critical thinking and analytical skills to support problem solving and error remediation.
Ability to apply strong communication and presentation skills with internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to understand the patient safety repercussions of an inaccurate decision/analysis of patient records, and an understanding of how to contain and correct the inaccuracy.
Strong emotional intelligence when working amongst team and with customers.
Ability to demonstrate self-awareness in the workplace.


Employment Type: Permanent Full Time

Salary Band: 4

Location: Ontario (currently hybrid; subject to change)

All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.

Internal Application Deadline Date: September 19, 2024

External Application Deadline Date: October 1, 2024

Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; members of Black and racialized groups; 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary individuals; and people living with disabilities.

Ontario Health is an accessible employer and we offer accommodation in all aspects of employment, including the recruitment process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us and a member of the team will connect with you within 48 hours.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

CapTech is an award-winning consulting firm that collaborates with clients to achieve what’s possible through the power of technology. At CapTech, we’re passionate about the work we do and the results we achieve for our clients. From the outset, our founders shared a collective passion to create a consultancy centered on strong relationships that would stand the test of time. Today we work alongside clients that include Fortune 100 companies, mid-sized enterprises, and government agencies, a list that spans across the country.

Job Description

CapTech’s Data Analysts work within a collaborative, team environment to help define and deliver innovative solutions to our clients. At the intersection of data and strategy, Data Analysts play a key role in capturing requirements, designing business processes and data models, and delivering actionable data to stakeholders. Data Analysts are passionate about interpreting data to help our clients make informed decisions and they are driven by a desire to solve our clients’ most complex business problems. Data Analysts work alongside like-minded peers who share their commitment to excellence and with visionary leaders who are invested in their success.

Specific job responsibilities will vary by project role, but may include:


Quantify ambiguous business problems by analyzing business processes, data, and systems and gathering data requirements from clients
Implement data governance best practices by capturing data definitions, identifying data stewards, and data transformations through source-to-target mappings
Develop data collection systems, implement databases and analytics to optimize efficiency
Conduct data quality analysis and provide recommendations for effective quality assurance processes that improve data health
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques that provide valuable insights and guide decision making across the business
Develop reports using modern data visualization tools and best practices to surface valuable insights to end-users
Communicate with all levels of stakeholders as appropriate, including executives, data modelers, application developers, business users, and customers to build solutions and interpret results
Collaborate with other data workstreams (Data Engineers, Data Architects, Data Scientists, Product Owners) on specific projects


Qualifications

Typical experience for successful candidates includes:


Experience working in an Agile development environment, including requirements definition and testing
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical languages and packages for analyzing large datasets
Demonstrable experience in the design of data models, database design development, data profiling, and various data analysis tools
Demonstrable experience with ETL/ELT, data ingestion, and data munging/wrangling
Experience in communicating concepts to both business and technical audiences
Excellent interpersonal, collaboration, communication, and leadership skills


Skills

Successful candidates usually have demonstrable experience with technologies in some of these categories:


Languages: SQL, Python, R
Database: Hive, Snowflake, SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, Aurora, DynamoDB, Cosmos, MongoDB, Cassandra
Additional Technologies: dbt, Spark, FiveTran, Databricks, PowerBI, Tableau, git


Additional Information

We want everyone at CapTech to be able to envision a lasting and rewarding career here, which is why we offer a variety of career paths based on your skills and passions. You decide where and how you want to develop, and we help get you there with customizable career progression and a comprehensive benefits package to support you along the way. Alongside our suite of traditional benefits encompassing generous PTO, health coverage, disability insurance, paid family leave and more, we’ve launched extended benefits to help meet our employees’ needs.


CapFlex – Employee-first mentality that supports a remote and hybrid workforce and empowers daily flexibility while servicing our clients
Learning & Development – Programs offering certification and tuition support, digital on-demand learning courses, mentorship, and skill development paths
Modern Health –A mental health and well-being platform that provides 1:1 care, group support sessions, and self-serve resources to support employees and their families through life’s ups and downs
Carrot Fertility –Inclusive fertility and family-forming coverage for all paths to parenthood – including adoption, surrogacy, fertility treatments, pregnancy, and more – and opportunities for employer-sponsored funds to help pay for care
Fringe –A company paid stipend program for personalized lifestyle benefits, allowing employees to choose benefits that matter most to them – ranging from vendors like Netflix, Spotify, and GrubHub to services like student loan repayment, travel, fitness, and more
Employee Resource Groups – Employee-led committees that embrace and incorporate diversity and inclusion into our day-to-day operations
Philanthropic Partnerships – Opportunities to engage in partnerships and pro-bono projects that support our communities.
401(k) Matching – Generous matching and no vesting period to help you continue to build financial wellness


CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace. For more information about our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging efforts, click HERE. As part of this commitment, CapTech will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Laura Massa directly via email lmassa@captechconsulting.com.

At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

As part of this commitment, CapTech will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Laura Massa directly via email lmassa@captechconsulting.com.

At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Stio® is an omni-channel mountain brand that designs, develops and sells beautiful, functional, and innovative apparel, footwear and other accessories infused with the soul of the mountain lifestyle. With headquarters in Jackson, Wyoming, Stio draws inspiration from the surrounding Teton Range and offers product via Stio.com, catalog and its Mountain Studio® retail locations.

We live and love mountain life, and as such see ourselves as caretakers of the resources that provide it. We are proud partners of Protect Our Winters and the Conservation Alliance among many other organizations. We have a strong preferred materials platform, use Bluesign® approved textiles wherever possible, audit our supply chains for best practices, and operate our workplaces responsibly.

We think that outside is the best side and that you can't improve on nature. It's good for mind, body and soul, and it's our responsibility to help enable access for all people, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, background or ability. We strive for inclusion at Stio and in our local and national communities.

YOUR ROLE

The Data Analyst will be an important player in enhancing Stio's ability to leverage data to inform decision making across the company. This is a full-stack analyst position with an end-to-end focus: the work ranges from helping to build foundational data infrastructure to diving deep into specific functional areas to guide business strategy. As an early member of a growing analytics team, the Data Analyst will have the chance to make a broad, tangible impact on our infrastructure, processes, and analysis projects. Working closely with a variety of teams from finance and operations to marketing and product development, the Data Analyst will analyze business performance using existing tools, then design better ones. They will help shape our data into more useful forms and work to tie analysis to action.

We are looking for a detail-oriented analyst who can connect what they see in the data to the bigger picture. The right candidate is someone who doesn't hesitate to sweep the floor (e.g., fix a broken Excel link) and isn't afraid to think outside the box (e.g., does this metric actually measure what is intended?). A foundation of technical skills is essential, but even more important is an eagerness to learn new things and a desire to drive positive progress at Stio.

This is a remote role that is part of the Finance department and reports to the Senior Business Analyst.

Your Responsibilities


Ownership of seasonal reporting and analysis that informs go-to-market product strategy (e.g., product returns reporting, product color performance analysis)
Creation and maintenance of business intelligence dashboards that support departments across the company
Assist in building and maintaining Stio's data infrastructure (currently Fivetran, Microsoft Fabric, Spark/SQL/dbt, R, Power BI in addition to Excel and various data sources)
Conducting ad hoc analysis to better understand business performance both proactively and in support of senior leadership questions
Automating manual reporting and analysis tasks
Improving data governance by creating documentation for both processes and data objects
Continuous learning to improve knowledge of technical best practices



Your Skills And Experience


3+ years of relevant past professional experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or similar role
Advanced Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, various lookup functions, comfortable writing efficient formulas, easily-to-follow work)
Experience as a developer with at least one BI tool (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)
A minimum of intermediate SQL skills required (e.g., grouping and aggregations, case statements, joins)
Experience creating presentations and communicating analysis findings to leadership (verbally, written, and visually)



Preferred Additional Skills And Experience


Though not required, we would consider the following as an added plus:
Advanced SQL skills (e.g., subqueries, window functions, and data wrangling)
Experience with coding languages used for analytics (e.g., R, Python)
Experience with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery) and data transformation tools (e.g., dbt)
Experience with some of systems we use: Netsuite, Shopify, Google Analytics, Segment
Professional experience with a direct-to-consumer company in the retail, apparel/footwear, outdoor equipment industries



THE FINE PRINT


Medical, Dental Vision plans
Company Paid Long Term Disability
Employee Assistance Program
401k with Match
Company DEI Committee
Generous paid time off policies
Gear test, perks, and more


We provide competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay, incentives and benefits. The base salary range for this role is $62,000-$80,000. It would not be typical for someone to be hired at the top end of the range for the role, as actual pay will be determined based on several factors including experience, skills and qualifications.

This job description is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, efforts, or working conditions associated with the job. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, we reserve the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed. Stio is an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals, including minorities, BIPOC, LGBTQ+, veterans & individuals with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Insight Global is looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our top banking clients for a 6-month contract with high opportunities of extension. This is a 2-day hybrid role downtown Toronto. The Data Analyst will be joining the risk group responsible for monitoring and helping to define policies and products that address areas of significant risk. This team is accountable for a cross-functional, multi-year data architecture and technology platform development initiative to deliver new data and tech capabilities to support robust and timely insights related to risk appetite and capital management and enable data governance practices that enhance transparency and data integrity. The Data Analyst will be expected to understand and articulate the use case based on the business opportunity and the estimated value being delivered. They will use advanced analytical algorithms and technologies to mine and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data to obtain insights and discover opportunities through end-to-end analysis of the existing data pipeline. The analysis will help to design and construct new processes for capital reporting, leveraging big data technology to design solutions that deliver smarter business decisions, improve customer experience, and drive productivity. They will collaborate with other data and analytics professionals and teams to optimize, refine, and scale analysis into mature analytics solutions.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- 1-2+ years of hands-on experience in performing deep-dive analysis from databases and deciphering technical documentation to understandable rules

- 1-2+ years of experience with SQL, Python, AWS SageMaker, and PySpark

- Fast learner with keen interest in big-data applications and a self-starter attitude

- Ability to build various prototypes independently (including data processes, visualizations, and calculations)

- Conducts large-scale analysis of information to discover patterns and trends by combining different modules and algorithms

- Ability to translate business needs to technical specifications

- Ability to develop tools and deliver training programs for the use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users

- Ability to document data flow, systems, and processes to improve the design, implementation, and management of business and group processes

- Excellent communication, collaboration, and time management skills to manage multiple deliveries simultaneously and work with different teams and stakeholders to enhance usability and aesthetic appeal of data analytics solutions

NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

- Knowledge of BASEL Accords and financial products

- CFA/FRM or other related certifications

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
En el área de Datos de Mutua Madrileña queremos incorporar un Business Data Analyst para la vertical de Auditoría Finanzas y Riesgos.




Como Business Data Analyst trabajarás codo con codo con expertos de negocio para el desarrollo de aplicaciones y activos de explotación que permitan maximizar sus capacidades y obtener un retorno claro y conciso




Funciones del puesto:

Identificar oportunidades para transformar datos en palancas de Negocio, y proponer, elaborar y defender business case con un driver económico.
Trabajar con los clientes internos en entender sus necesidades para diseñar e implementar las aplicaciones, visualizaciones y activos que se requieran basadas en las necesidades del negocio
Implementar y evolucionar aplicaciones que permitan operar y tomar decisiones de negocio de forma innovadora.
Evolucionar las capacidades de visualización y análisis de datos asegurando un diseño atractivo para el usuario




Perfil solicitado:

Formación universitaria
Necesaria experiencia en el sector asegurador/financiero y/o ahorro e inversión.




Competencias necesarias:

Habilidad para entender e interpretar los requisitos de los usuarios y convertirlos en habilitadores para transformar el negocio
Conocimiento, proactividad y curiosidad en generar valor a partir del análisis de grandes volúmenes de información.
Experiencia en creación o diseños de cuadros de mando.

Se valorará:

Experiencia en gestión de proyectos orientados a negocio
Experiencia en entornos de trabajo dinámicos (Lean) con objetivos concretos y con foco en la iteración con usuarios.




Además de la cualificación profesional buscamos personas con valores basados en la relevancia, la autenticidad y la superación para lograr los objetivos marcados.




Mutua es #ElLugarqueTeMereces




Aceptando suscribirse a esta oferta consiente el tratamiento de sus datos personales conforme a los términos y condiciones establecidos en: https://www.grupomutua.es/proteccion-de-datos/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mercedes-Benz Financial Services is the brand finance company of the Mercedes-Benz Group. Our goal? To offer mobility and financing solutions to all customers and lovers of our star.




We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales and Loyalty team. The objective is that through descriptive analytics and diagnosis, insights and recommendations can be generated that support better decision-making and help increase the conversion of the online channel.




For this reason you have to be able to work autonomously and that you like it. In addition, you have to be independent but in a highly collaborative environment. We are looking for a professional who is passionate and motivated by data and their work, ready to be challenged and challenged!




Responsibilities:




Perform a variety of analyses to discover audiences and behaviors in CRM, with the goal of finding and implementing new use cases.
Create audiences so that they can be used for A/B testing, CRM activations and even Paid Media.
Be able to define KPIs for the evaluation of marketing activations and verify that these measurements are technically possible
Evaluate the success of personalized actions and define the next steps due to learning.
Identification of Insights with clear commercial recommendations.
Be able to perform query Google Cloud.
Work as a team with the IT & BI areas to collaborate in the evaluation of data quality and build new data, tools, etc.




Qualification:




Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or another degree with a strong analytical content
Total mastery of Excel, SAS and SQL (knowledge of other programming languages such as R or Python will be an asset)
English level B1.2 or above, with at least 3 years of experience in a comparable position, transforming data to extract key business insights using statistical/analytical concepts







Skills:




Independent, motivated, proactive and ready to take responsibilities to the next level
Be able to work in a team
Be an organized but adaptable and flexible person in the face of a dynamic and changing environment
Be eager to learn and understand the goals and needs of the business
Excellent communication skills, being able to translate the execution of technical data into insights and business recommendations
Customer-centric and problem-solving with communication skills that favor multidisciplinary work
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst




📍 Località: Roma, zona Eur




🕒 Tipo di Contratto: tempo indeterminato, full-time




✨ Su di noi

Benvenutə in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.




🎯 La tua sfida

Sei curiosə di sapere quali sono i dati con i quali lavoriamo per tutelare i diversi repertori artistici? Sei neolaureatə e hai voglia di fare la differenza mettendoti in gioco? La sfida offerta da SIAE è quella di trasformare grandi quantità di dati in informazioni utili al supporto delle decisioni strategiche delle diverse funzioni aziendali.




💼 Le Tue Responsabilità

Analisi di dati: raccoglierai e organizzerai dati per migliorarne la qualità e l’affidabilità e identificherai modelli, tendenze e insights

Creazione di dashboard e report: comunicherai i risultati dell’analisi in modo chiaro ed efficace ai diversi team aziendali

Sviluppo e implementazione di modelli predittivi: utilizzerai algoritmi di machine learning e tecniche statistiche

Collaborazione con team interfunzionali: contribuirai al cambiamento aziendale integrando soluzioni analitiche nei processi e identificando opportunità di miglioramento




🎓 Requisiti

Formazione: laurea in discipline STEM

Lingue: buona conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata

Linguaggi di programmazione: Python, R, SQL, Qlik, Power BI, Tableau

Pacchetto Office: conoscenza eccellente di Excel e Power Point

Soft Skills: Eccellenti capacità comunicative, problem-solving e team working




🌈 Nice to have:

Esperienza lavorativa minima/ stage come data analyst

Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati

Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione

Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”




💰 Cosa Offriamo

Contributo Welfare Aziendale

Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno

Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese

Premio di Risultato

Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute

Contributo Previdenza Complementare

Borse di Studio per i figli

Abbonamento Annuale alla piattaforma linguistica Speexx

Servizio di VideoVisite 7 giorni su 7, dalle 9:00 alle 23:00

Supporto Psicologico e Nutrizionale




🌟 I nostri valori

Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto

Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità

Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione

Entrepreneurship: siamo intraprendenti e valorizziamo iniziative e intuizioni




🚀 Unisciti a Noi: valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst! 




About Us: At Marveltest, we’re at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we’re looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We’re looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You’ll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role: As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you’ll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:




Data Warehousing: Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
Tableau Workbooks: Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
Analytical Structures: Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
Ad hoc Analyses: Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
Client Communication: Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
Documentation: Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.




Collaboration within the Data Team: You’ll work closely with:

Business Analyst: Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
Data Science/Engineering: Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.




Required Skillset:

Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
Excel: Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
Tableau (Advanced): 1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
SQL: Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
Business Acumen: Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.
Knowledge about online marketing metrics and business performance metrics.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Data Simplification: Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
Proactive Mindset: Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
Client Communication: Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.




What do I get in return? 

Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we’re just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
26 paid holidays a year.
A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop
Show more

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Join a best-in-class team that brings ideas, innovation and passion

• Work directly with senior management from various business units

• The ability to grow and shape your own career

• Collaborative creative environment

• Working on real business problems

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data modelling) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Develop Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives




You have:




• 0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools

• Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed

• Advanced written and verbal communications in English

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong sense of identifying priorities

• The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently

• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions

• The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations

• At least Bachelor’s Degree




You preferably have:




• Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)

• Experience with SQL, DataIku




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. You will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
About the role:

As a Data Analyst, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate closely with our dynamic teams and working on multiple tasks. You will play an important role in creating engaging and insightful data visualizations using Tableau, using advanced data analysis and modelling techniques to find valuable trends and patterns within our datasets. Your involvement in developing and maintaining data models, reports, and workflows will be crucial to our success. Furthermore, you will actively engage with various business units, gaining a deep understanding of their unique needs and creating customized dashboards and solutions to meet and exceed their expectations.




About the project:

Duration: 2-3 months

The project contains 2 parts of development:

The backend (data warehouse ) using the in-house data centre to develop a solution from data collocation to structured database (in storge ) ,
The frontend (visualisation ) : using the structured database in storge with the Tableau we cerate advance models flows in addition to build the dashboard visualizations.




What are the expectations/requirements?

You are already based in the Netherlands

Re-creation of existing dashboard and visualizations from PowerBI to tableau.

Creating data models from database using tableau Prep for visualizations

Creating new deep dives upon request

Interacting with multiple stakeholders to understand their requirements and implementing them in their dashboards

Gaid and support the stakeholders to understand and unlock the potential dashboard

Creating appealing dashboards and visualization, knowledge of UXUI would be nice




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the data solutions team to design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions
Create interactive and insightful data visualizations using Tableau
Perform complex data analysis and modelling to uncover trends, patterns, and insights using Tableau prep and SQL.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Discuss with business units (clients) to understand their needs and create dashboards tailored to their expectations
Contribute to the documentation of processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and project planning activities




Want to know more about us?

We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.

Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.

We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.

We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.

The Role:
As a Junior Data Analyst on our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.

In this Role, your responsibilities will include:

* Monitor and Analyze Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
* Generate Insights for Campaign Optimization: Assist in analyzing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
* Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
* Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
* Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimization and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
* Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
* Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.

What you'll Need to Succeed:

* Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
* Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
* Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
* Basic Data Visualization Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
* Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
* Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimization. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.

Why Trip.com Group
We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.
What’s more?

* Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions

* Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact

* We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.

* We encourage flexible work arrangement

* Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.

Click[1] the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?

Click [2] the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!

Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com

Have a good trip, and see you soon!


References

Visible links
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w4D31J3atps
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQSUxvFTyqM

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Leading and working with the team, you will blend mathematical, analytical, and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analyzing data to deliver main Marketing Services products.

What you'll do?


Support shaping and refinement of projects.
Deliver projects
Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content.
Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as Python, Alteryx or WPS/SAS.
Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.
Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.


Desirable


Knowledge of any of the following programs / languages; SAS, Alteryx, R, SPSS, VBA, SQL, WPS, ArcGIS, or Python.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

HTML:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into an Analytics Manager within the Product Development team you will focus on data analyses. Leading and working with the team, you will blend mathematical, analytical, and spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analyzing data to deliver main Marketing Services products.

What you'll do?

  • Support shaping and refinement of projects.
  • Deliver projects
  • Provide mentoring to Analysts in the team.
  • Ensure knowledge transfer of analysis (interpretation; justification; methods).
  • Be an escalation point for analysts to support their work.
  • Ensure all work is process checked and sense checked following team checking guidelines.

Qualifications

What you'll bring:

  • Degree with high mathematical / technical / analytical content.
  • Experienced user of at least one analytical program, such as Python, Alteryx or WPS/SAS.
  • Proficient in the use of MS excel (can perform complex functions).
  • Experience interpreting analysis outputs, providing insight and making recommendations.
  • Proficient in advanced analytical methods, such as modelling and segmentation.

Desirable

  • Knowledge of any of the following programs / languages; SAS, Alteryx, R, SPSS, VBA, SQL, WPS, ArcGIS, or Python.

Additional Information

What you will get:

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst (Analista de Datos)
Place: Villanueva de la Cañada, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
SEK Education Group busca incorporar un/a Analista de Datos.

FUNCIONES:

Gestión de Datos: Recolectar, integrar, limpiar y preparar datos de diversas fuentes para su análisis.
Análisis de Datos: Realizar análisis detallados, incluyendo análisis exploratorio, modelado estadístico y análisis predictivo para obtener insights.
Comunicación de Insights: Visualizar los hallazgos a través de informes, paneles y presentaciones para facilitar la toma de decisiones informadas en toda la organización.




REQUISITOS:

Grado universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería u otro campo relacionado.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en un rol técnico, preferiblemente de analista de datos.
Español (hablado y escrito); conocimiento de inglés recomendable.
Conocimientos técnicos mínimos: PowerBI, SQL y Azure Data Factory.
Skills Deseables: Conocimientos Azure, APIs: (REST APIs), Microsoft Fabric, Conocimientos de frameworks de gobierno del dato, dominio de herramientas de análisis de datos y modelos estadísticos (Python).

SE OFRECE:

Contrato indefinido.
Horario: Lunes a Viernes, de 9:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.

Title: Data Analyst (Lille)
Description:
Vous Travaillerez Au Sein D’une Équipe Data De L’un De Nos Clients Du Retail. Vos Missions Seront Les Suivantes


Définir, améliorer et analyser les KPI’s pertinents
Construire et alimenter des modèles de données
Produire des analyses détaillées et qualitatives de l’activité opérationnelle compréhensible par les métiers
Formuler des recommandations, préparer des rapports et présentations de façon régulière aux parties prenantes afin d’établir des stratégies à court et à long terme et d’améliorer l’efficacité du service
Produire des dashboards user-friendly
Faire remonter les incidents intervenus sur les outils exploitant de la data et être ainsi garant de la qualité des données
Maintenir une documentation claire et exhaustive


Environnement Technique

Langages : Python, SQL

Environnement cloud : Azure, GCP, AWS

Data visualisation: Power BI, Tableau, Data Studio, Qlik, SAP BO

Modélisation de donnée: Big Query, Databricks

Title: Junior Data Entry Analyst
Description:
The role is part of the Global Account Services Signer Transformation Team and is responsible for driving the strategic development of the Account Services Offering to our global clients.

The individual will be responsible for ensuring there are appropriate focus, traction and progress in delivering this key transformation initiatives.

Key responsibilities


Populate daily tracker
Carry out manual data extraction and transposition of data for all non structured signers
Depending on complexity, if there are scope rules Project Ops will complete the Scope Rule validation and Scope manual extraction where possible
Carry Out Rule Validation Activity for rules created by Technology within the required timeframe
Issue Log to be updated
Progress, issues and defects to be socialized between the teams
Carry out manual remediation


Knowledge/Experience:


Experience of work in a process driven environment
You speak English at communicative level
You are good at excel
You have attention to detail, are responsible and learn quickly
You are open to new experiences and development within a global company
You work well within a team and can cooperate with others


What we offer:


Competitive salary connected with annual salary review and discretionary annual performance bonus;
Social benefits (private healthcare, award winning pension scheme, multisport, life insurance, holiday allowance, anniversary program, competitive maternity and paternity scheme);
Hybrid model of work – from modern offices and from home, flexible working hours;
Working in a friendly, dynamic, supportive and diverse environment – including multiple affinity and social networks & voluntary activities to engage with;
Structured onboarding process and extensive training offering (e.g. including Udemy, Degreed);
Opportunity to have an influence on the way you perform your tasks - our teams are constantly looking for new and better ways and we encourage all improvement ideas;
Unlimited development opportunities within Citi global network;
Exposure to a wide range of internal stakeholders as well as to senior management.


------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:

Customer Service

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:

Institutional Client Onboarding

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:

Full time

------------------------------------------------------

Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

Title: BI & Data Analyst
Description:
Groupon is an experienced marketplace that brings people more ways to get the most out of their city or wherever they may be. By enabling real-time mobile commerce across local businesses, live events, and travel destinations, Groupon helps people find and discover experiences––big and small, new and familiar––that make for a full, fun, and rewarding life. Groupon helps local businesses grow and strengthen customer relationships––resulting in strong, vibrant communities. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking, and celebrates success.

At Groupon, we know that great people make great companies. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive.

We are looking for a BI & Data Analyst to join a small team focused on discount deals and affiliate.

Role requirements:


Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.
Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.
May directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.


Qualification:


1+ years of experience in data analysis
Good knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of visualization tools like: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker
Fluent English
Communicative, team work


Groupon’s purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world’s largest local ecommerce marketplace, click here. You can also find out more about us in the latest Groupon news as well as learning about our DEI approach. If all of this sounds like something that’s a great fit for you, then click apply and join us on a mission to become the ultimate destination for local experiences and services.

Beware of Recruitment Fraud: Groupon follows a merit-based recruitment process without charging job seekers any fees. We've noticed an increase in recruitment fraud, including fake job postings and fraudulent interviews and job offers aimed at stealing personal information or money. Be cautious of individuals falsely representing Groupon's Talent Acquisition team with fake job offers. If you encounter any suspicious job offers or interview calls demanding money, recognize these as scams. Groupon is not responsible for losses from such dealings. For legitimate job openings, always check our official careers website at grouponcareers.com.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
HTML:
A AdvanceCare, plataforma especializada na gestão de seguros e planos de saúde, pretende reforçar a sua equipa com novos talentos para integrar uma cultura organizacional dinâmica e inovadora.


Integrado na área de Gestão de Produto, terá como principais responsabilidades:

  • Desenho de modelos preditivos de negócio;
  • Implementar soluções de reporting;
  • Desenvolver relatórios de acompanhamento da evolução do comportamento da carteira;
  • Desenvolver métodos de cálculo adequados para projeção de custos, garantindo a credibilidade dos resultados;
  • Preparar informação/ documentação de suporte para tomada de decisão.


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado nas áreas de matemática ou ciências atuariais;
  • Conhecimento de análise de dados;
  • Capacidade analítica e de planeamento;
  • Dinamismo e proatividade;
  • Pensamento crítico.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.


With the following qualities…


A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe's largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 154 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 82 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737's on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe's No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe's greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO₂ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines.

The Role:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to work in a multi-disciplined team alongside Developers, Designers and Product Owners, who will own their work from the initial idea to the final implementation. The role will also involve mentoring junior members of the team who have an understanding of the area, but may need to lean on a more experienced colleague from time-to-time.

The role sits inside the BI team. The BI team are made up of 80+ people split across the three Ryanair offices: Dublin, Madrid & Wroclaw. Within the BI team there is a range of different professions: Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Optimization Specialists, Data Modellers, BI Analysts & BI Reporters.

Requirements


Education: Relevant Undergrad Degree in field of Analytics, Masters preferable
Work Experience: Relevant work experience in Data Analytics/Data Science positions
Commercially focussed. The Commercial team are the stakeholders for the majority of Data Analytics projects undertaken. The candidate must be commercially astute and be able to recognise the value of projects. Job performance is largely assessed by commercial value added
Ability to work independently. Crucial to be a self-starter and consistently show initiative & diligence on a daily basis. The team is built up of people who generate ideas and show initiative in the work they do. Take full responsibility for projects, and ensure they are delivered on time
Communication Skills: Candidate must be communicative - most projects involve multiple people across various teams in different departments across the three offices. It is very necessary to be comfortable speaking with people regularly on a daily basis
Analytical mindset: Be inquisitive and curious with data. Be able to interpret and analyse data. Be able to construct a story through data. Ability to uncover answers to important business questions through data
Confident Presenter: The role will involve very regular presentations to non-technical audiences. It is important to be a confident & skilled presenter
Direct Reports: Ability to delegate work to & manage Junior Data Analysts



Technical - Requirements


Coding Language: Experience in Python/R. Python/R are regularly used across the BI team
SQL: SQL experience from previous jobs is required. Need to be fluent in writing SQL queries to extract data from Data Warehouses
Excel - extensive experience required. Spreadsheets very commonly used, need to be very comfortable working in Excel (pivot tables, extensive formula knowledge)
Data Visualization - A very important aspect of the role is to be able to explain analysis through the use of data visualizations. Experience with Data Viz software is preferred e.g. Tableau/PowerBI
PowerPoint/Google Slides - Ability to quickly put together slide decks that summarize your analysis, and clearly tell a story. Have expertise in designing a range of styles of slide decks for varying audiences
Data Validation: Important to be capable of validating datasets you work with contain correct information



Benefits

Flight Benefits

Hybrid model (3 days of work from home)

Regular social meetings!
Show more
