Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Financial Services




We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst with a strong background in SQL, R, Python and Power BI to join a growing financial services organisation on a permanent basis.




The role will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights, generating reports and developing visual dashboards to support business operations and strategic initiatives.




The ideal candidate will possess the ability to gather, analyse and interpret large datasets to support data driven decision-making processes.




The Role




Extract, clean, and manage large datasets from various data sources using SQL, R and Python.
Design and maintain efficient databases, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Work with the wider business teams to define data needs and requirements.
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, patterns and insights.
Use statistical methods and machine learning algorithms in R and Python to analyse data and forecast trends.
Design, build, and maintain data models to support reporting and analysis needs.
Create interactive and dynamic reports and dashboards using Power BI to present insights to stakeholders.
Translate complex data into easy-to-understand visualisations and presentations.
Monitor and maintain existing dashboards, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and provide actionable insights based on data analysis.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation using data insights.
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and concise manner.




The Person




Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field.
6 years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases and manipulating large datasets.
Experience in R and Python for statistical analysis, machine learning and automation tasks.
Strong knowledge of Power BI for creating dashboards and data visualisations.
Familiarity with other data visualisation tools like Tableau or Excel.
Hands-on experience with database design, data warehousing and ETL processes.
Strong statistical and data modelling skills.
Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical mindset.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.




Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Analista de datos (PowerBI)
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 5 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Energía, Infraestructuras y Marketing Digital.




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL




🕵🏽‍♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍♂️




Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el desarrollo y diseño de soluciones utilizando Power BI.
Experiencia en PowerBI, incluida la creación de informes y cuadros de mando desde cero (mucho énfasis en diseño de los mismos)
Fuerte capacidad para escribir fórmulas DAX avanzadas para cálculos personalizados.
Experiencia en el diseño de modelos de datos eficientes y relaciones entre tablas.
Valorable: conocimiento en Microsoft Fabric o Python
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación en castellano e inglés (mucha comunicación será con clientes internacionales) y capacidad para conceptualizar las necesidades del cliente.




¡Y lo más importante de todo, que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado.

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Analista (m/h/x) de datos junior (Excel, SQL y PowerBi)
Description:
¿Te consideras una persona analítica? ¿Te gusta trabajar con datos? ¿Buscas un nuevo proyecto en un ambiente favorable y motivador en una empresa líder en el sector energético? Si tu respuesta es afirmativa, ¡continúa leyendo!

MANPOWERGROUP incorpora perfil Técnico (m/h/x) análisis de datos y reporting para una importante empresa del sector energético.

¿QUÉ HARÁS?

Refuerzo actividad en el envío de ofertas a Sistemas. Soporte al equipo B2CPyP en la actividad de B2C

Refuerzo actividad de ofertas a Sistemas:

Apoyo en el cálculo de precios para las ofertas de B2C
Preparación de plantillas con el detalle de las ofertas a cargar en Sistemas
Revisión correcta implantación de las ofertas en Sistemas

Soporte actividad B2C:

Soporte en la elaboración de las ofertas para B2C
Preparación de informes de seguimiento de contratación
Apoyo en la interlocución con el Área de Marketing




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?

· Contrato: indefinido a través de Manpower

· Jornada completa

· Horario: L – V de 9h-18h

· Salario 26.000€ b/a

· Zona: Madrid

REQUISITOS:

Grado / Licenciatura en Empresariales, Economía, Matemáticas, Administración de Empresas; Ingeniería Industrial, de la Energía o Informática. Valorables otras titulaciones si cumplen con todos los requisitos de conocimiento y experiencia.




Se valorará conocimiento en el sector energético, mercados eléctricos y formación del precio de la energía.




Nivel avanzado en paquete Office, especialmente de Excel.

Conocimiento básico de bases de datos (elaboración de consultas sencillas en SQL).

Se valorarán conocimientos en PowerBI.

Persona con carácter comunicativo y abierto.




Si estás en búsqueda y cuentas con experiencia ¡no dudes en inscribirte! BUSCAMOS EL TALENTO Y LA MOTIVACIÓN ¡TE BUSCAMOS A TI!

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca, per una Società del Gruppo, di un profilo di HR Data Analyst, che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Human Resources & Organization.




Principali attività:

Elaborazione periodica degli analytics HR consolidati (per tutte le entità legali del Gruppo)
Gestione end-to-end delle attività di reporting e controlling: dalla raccolta dati all’analisi dei trend
Predisposizione del Budget HR e del costo del personale, e relative analisi di scostamento
Monitoraggio dei KPI HR in coordinamento con le Direzioni (es. monitoraggio ferie, attrition)
Presentazione dei dati analizzati
Garantire standard per data quality e consistency
Supporto ai progetti di HRIS




Requisiti:

Laurea Magistrale, preferibilmente in materie STEM
Un Master in risorse umane sarà considerato un plus
Richiesta pregressa esperienza di 3 anni in posizioni analoghe in Società di Consulenza o in società complesse
Conoscenza base di gestionali HR (Workday e Zucchetti saranno considerati un plus)
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e Powerpoint
Inglese livello minimo B2
Ottime capacità analitiche
Precisione ed accuratezza
Riservatezza ed affidabilità




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
Ticket restaurant;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 32k a 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinchè il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.




*****




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a HR Data Analyst profile for a Group Company, who will join the Human Resources & Organization Department.




Main activities:




Periodic processing of consolidated HR analytics (for all legal entities of the Group)
End-to-end management of reporting and controlling activities: from data collection to trend analysis
Preparation of HR and personnel cost budgets and related variance analyses
Monitoring of HR KPIs in coordination with Management (e.g. holiday monitoring, attrition)
Presentation of analysed data
Ensuring standards for data quality and consistency
Supporting HRIS projects




Requirements:

Master's degree, preferably in STEM subjects
A Master's degree in Human Resources will be considered a plus
Previous experience of 3 years in similar positions in Consultancy or complex companies required
Basic knowledge of HR management software (Workday and Zucchetti will be considered a plus)
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint
English level at least B2
Excellent analytical skills
Accuracy and precision
Confidentiality and reliability




What you will find in Lottomatica

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Ticket restaurant;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (32k to 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination.




At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment.




We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3 years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?







Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject,
3+ years of experience as data Analyst;
Expertise with Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
Fluency in English;
The candidate has to be in Lisbon - hybrid position.




Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
A propos de Nous


???????????????????????? est une marque de l’entreprise Skayl dédiée à l'Ingénierie Industrielle et à l’Intérim Management.


Nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs enjeux d’investissements pour améliorer leur compétitivité en anticipant le monde technologique et humain de demain.

Dans le cadre de projet technique de nos clients, nous renforçons nos équipes.

Faire partie de l’aventure ???????????????????????????????????????? ????????????????????????, c’est entrer dans un environnement collaboratif pour avoir un impact.

Votre mission, si vous l'acceptez

Au sein de votre équipe, votre mission principale est le suivi de la qualité des données de consommation pour améliorer la gestion des projets.

Vos Missions Dans Le Détail


Suivre la récupération et la qualité des données de consommation utilisées dans la facturation et la mise en œuvre des régularisations (courbes de charge et index)
En lien avec le projet MDM (metering, data, monitoring), définir et construire les outils de reportings nécessaires au suivi quotidien de la qualité des courbes de charge, particulièrement les courbes de charge utilisées dans les process de facturation
Définir et construire les outils permettant de récupérer les données de consommation réalisées pour alimenter les calculs des régularisations annuelles sur des périmètres de sites profilés
Comprendre, cataloguer l’origine des problèmes de récupération des données de consommation (courbe de charge et index) et coordonner leur résolution ponctuelle et structurelle
Structurer et améliorer les processus de suivi et de résolution
Fournir un appui analytique à la conduite d'exploration et à l'analyse complexe de données
Contribuer aux projets nécessaires au bon déroulement et à l’amélioration de l’activité
Contribuer à la définition et l’amélioration des process de facturation des offres de prestation du client
Participer aux projets d’automatisation des outils de traitement des données de consommation et participer aux phases de recette lors de livraison des outils

Le profil idéal, selon nous

De formation Bac+5 (école d'ingénieur généraliste ou spécialisée dans l'énergie, master), vous avez une expérience 5 à 7 ans dans l'analyse et la gestion des données.

Vous avez un très bon niveau de maitrise SQL-Databricks, PowerBI et Excel notamment sur les fonctions avancées comme le croisement des données. Des compétences en programmation (Python) sont un plus.

Des connaissances sur la fourniture d’énergie et du fonctionnement des marchés de l’électricité/gaz sont un plus également.

Vous êtes rigoureux, organisé, pragmatique et autonome.

Vous faites preuve d’un bon esprit critique. Vous présentez de bonnes capacités d’analyse et de synthèse.

Vous avez le goût du travail en équipe et avez la capacité à vous coordonner avec des interlocuteurs aux profils variés.

Vous aimez l'opérationnel et savez faire preuve d'agilité et de transparence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Uber is looking for Data Analysts to expand its new Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions.

As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement.

In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes.

Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa.

This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program.

We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

What You Will Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What you will need


Knowledges in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)
Show more
HTML:
About The Role

Uber is looking for Data Analysts to expand its new Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions.

As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Ona estamos buscando a un/a Junior Data Analyst para nuestro departamento de Revenue.




¡Estamos en plena expansión y crecimiento!




¿Qué nos diferencia? ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Ona está creciendo muchísimo, es un momento muy bueno para entrar a formar parte de nosotros/as, crecer y construir juntos.
Contrato indefinido e incorporación inmediata.
Oportunidad de desarrollo y promoción interna.
Salario de incorporación: 24.000€ - 26.000 € (según experiencia)
Beneficios sociales: Retribución flexible Cobee, Adeslas a precio reducido, descuentos en nuestros complejos, RCI, descuentos en la plataforma ShoppyClub, entre otros.
Diferentes actividades a lo largo del año: Afterworks, evento de Navidad, etc...
Flexibilidad horaria, entrada entre 8:30 y 9:30; salida a partir de las 17:30. Viernes intensivos.




Serás una pieza fundamental y clave para este departamento, y para Ona.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones principales?




- Mantenimiento de bases de datos (SQL Server y Azure SQL, SSAS).

- Gestión de proyectos de diseño y despliegue de sistemas de información.

- Capacidad para traducir los datos recabados en información de valor.

- Diseño de informes que puedan ayudar al departamento de Revenue en soluciones técnicas y en la toma de decisiones.

- Experiencia en la creación de dashboards y reportes interactivos.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?




- Estudios universitarios en campos tecnológicos y TI, o Grado Superior con experiencia en el sector.

- Experiencia comprobable en desarrollo y creación de informes.

- Conocimientos en Power BI y SQL.

- Excelente capacidad de comunicación y presentación de informes.

- Trabajo en equipo y colaboración con diferentes departamentos.

- Adaptabilidad y aprendizaje continuo para mantenerse al día con las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.




Serán altamente valorados:

-Conocimientos comprobables con herramientas del entorno Microsoft Fabric / Microsoft Power Platform.

-Certificaciones en Power BI y/o SQL.

-Transact SQL o KQL.

Show more

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
excelia es una firma multinacional de Consultoría, Tecnología y Servicios profesionales con 25 años de experiencia. Prestamos servicio en más de 50 países de Europa, América Latina y Estados Unidos desde nuestras 10 oficinas propias.

Actualmente estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con experiencia en Power BI, para uno de nuestros clientes.




Modalidad: Remoto - Residir en España.




Requisitos:

• Experiencia sólida en Power BI

• Dominio de SQL Server Integration Services (SSII) y SQL (nivel alto)

• Experiencia fuerte en modelado de datos, ETL, conexiones a diversas fuentes, trabajo con indicadores.

• Conocimiento Base de Datos

• Plus: Conocimientos Azure: Data Factory (para transformar e integrar datos de diversas fuentes), desarrollo de notebooks, etc.

• Actitud proactiva, orientado al aprendizaje y solución de problemas técnicos.




Recomendamos habilidades en:

• Experiencia con manejo de algún lenguaje de programación como SQL, Python, Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Data Factory.

• Certificación PL-300 de Microsoft.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

📝 Contratación estable, para que puedas seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.

💰 Tu banda salarial será acorde a tu experiencia y tu trayectoria profesional.

😱 Además podrás beneficiarte a través de nuestro paquete de retribución flexible.

📖 Creemos en tu desarrollo profesional, por ello te ofrecemos formación continua. Queremos ayudarte a mejorar tus habilidades técnicas.

¿Te interesa la oportunidad? ¿Crees que encajas con el perfil que buscamos? ¡Haz clic en "inscribirme" y forma parte de excelia, una compañía internacional donde desarrollar todo tu talento!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Data_Analyst”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Per Iren Ambiente S.p.A., società del Gruppo specializzata nella gestione di servizi di igiene ambientale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst da inserire nella Control Room della Direzione Raccolte a Reggio Emilia con il compito di collaborare nell'ambito dei processi di innovazione e digitalizzazione relativi ai servizi operativi di nettezza urbana, raccolta e smaltimento dei rifiuti.


Attività:

-Elaborazione di report e statistiche mediante l'utilizzo di strumenti di B.I.;

-Analisi di dataset specifici finalizzate all'estrazione di insights operativi, utili alla definizione degli interventi migliorativi in ottica di efficienza;

-Calcolo e messa a disposizione di key performance indicator per il monitoraggio dei risultati;

-Monitoraggio dello svolgimento dei servizi di Raccolta e Spazzamento nei vari territori con vigilanza costante degli indicatori;

-Presentazione dei risultati delle analisi effettuate tramite l'utilizzo di data visualization;

-Raccolta, gestione e disamina di tutte le informazioni pertinenti ad un processo aziendale, modellazione e rappresentazione grafica di eventi e implicazioni sul business, comunicazione e condivisione delle informazioni con gli stakeholders al fine di monitorare l'andamento e le performance delle attività;

-Ottimizzazione dei processi.

-Supporto a IT e consulenti esterni per comprendere le esigenze lato business utili al miglioramento delle applicazioni esistenti e alla progettazione di nuove soluzioni.


Competenze:

  • conoscenza di metodologie di analisi dei processi;
  • conoscenza e capacità base di utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence quali Power BI, Qlik...
  • nozioni base di programmazione informatica, utilizzo di sistemi gestionali e di strumenti di reportistica;
  • buone conoscenze di matematica e statistica e correlata capacità di elaborazione, analisi ed interpretazione di dati;
  • capacità di utilizzo di tools di reporting.


Requisiti:

Titolo di studio richiesto:

  • Laurea di estrazione tecnica, preferibilmente in Ingegneria, Informatica o Economia e Commercio;
  • interesse per contesti tecnologici/digitali e sistemi complessi;
  • patente di guida di categoria B;
  • costituirà titolo preferenziale l’aver svolto precedenti esperienze nell’ambito delle aree logistica, trasporti o ciclo di gestione rifiuti.


Forma contrattuale di inserimento: apprendistato professionalizzante.


Sede: Reggio Emilia o, in subordine, Torino, con disponibilità a trasferte su territorio nazionale.


Saranno prese in considerazione esclusivamente le candidature corredate da Curriculum Vitae

I candidati ambosessi (D.lgs n. 198/2006) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo:

https://irenfutura.gruppoiren.it/irenlavoraconnoi/portals/0/IREN_InformativaCV_irenfutura.pd

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About our client

Our client is a leading European consulting firm partnering with one of the largest railway companies in Europe. They are at the forefront of revolutionizing rail transportation, combining advanced data analytics with sustainable practices to shape the future of mobility. The team is dedicated to transforming complex data into actionable insights, enabling innovation and optimization in the railway sector.

About the role

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can serve as the basis for our client's business decisions. You will work with large amounts of data and create reports and visualizations to communicate results to stakeholders effectively.

What will you do?


Extract, transform, and load data from different sources
Analyze data and identify patterns and trends
Create data visualizations and reports
Identify business opportunities through data analysis
Collaborate with other IT experts to optimize data processing workflows


Required skills and experience:


Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Expertise in analyzing and interpreting complex datasets
Proficiency in creating reports and visualizations to communicate results
Strong ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data
Experience working with large amounts of data
Proficiency in ML Programming Languages (e.g., Python, Pandas, Tensorflow, R)
Experience with Data Analytics Tools and Techniques
Ability to work effectively in a team environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills


Nice to have:


Experience in the transportation or logistics sector
Knowledge of advanced data visualization techniques
Familiarity with business intelligence tools
Experience with SQL and database querying
Understanding of statistical analysis methods
Background in data-driven decision making


We offer:


Flexible working format - remote, office-based or flexible
A competitive salary and good compensation package
Personalized career growth
Professional development tools (mentorship program, tech talks and trainings, centers of excellence, and more)
Active tech communities with regular knowledge sharing
Education reimbursement
Memorable anniversary presents
Corporate events and team buildings
Other location-specific benefits
Show more

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Lisbon. 100% On-site position




(NOTE: all certificates must be attached to the application in order to be consider)




The BI Business Analyst will integrate our Quality Department and play a key role in analyzing data and generating actionable insights to drive organisational decision-making.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify their data needs and define clear analytics objectives that support business goals.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable analytics frameworks, leveraging SQL and Power BI to extract, transform, and analyse datasets.
Create compelling, clear, concise reports and dashboards using Power BI, ensuring business users can easily understand and act upon the insights provided.
Conduct data validation and error-checking processes to guarantee the reliability and accuracy of analytics outputs, thereby upholding the trust in data-driven decision-making.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data to provide actionable insights that guide business strategies and decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data analysis needs and provide guidance on how best to use data to achieve objectives.
Keeping up to date with emerging trends and technologies in BI and data analysis and continually looking for ways to improve the organisation's data analysis processes and practices.




Requirements

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analysis or related fields.
+1 year of experience in Power BI for developing reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in a corporate environment.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis results clearly and understandably.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong focus on results.
Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).




We Offer:

Attractive salary package;
Vibrant culture, in a company that is actively involved in social responsibility;
Integration in a dynamic, passionate and enthusiastic team;
Equal opportunity mindset and encouragement to be innovative;
Personal and professional development;
Contact to a demanding industry with challenging projects;
Company-sponsored events, parties and concerts;




Enjoy the unique experience of working at MULTIVISION! If you are interested in this role, please send us your CV and certificates (mandatory) motivation letter.







MULTIVISION is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and workplace. We value diversity at our company regardless of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
ABOUT US:




Our company:

Founded in 1981, TCL Electronics (HKSE 01070), is a leading global tech brand in display panels, TVs, home comfort and mobile devices. TCL operates its manufacturing and R&D centers worldwide and has products and services in 160 + countries.




TCL Electronics has developed specific expertise, promoting vertical integration, i.e. manufacturing of its LEDTVs from A to Z.

We are official partner of Italian National Football Team.

TCL’s slogan or signature, « The Creative Life », sets the tone.




For more information, kindly visit our website.




The Role:




TCT Mobile Italy is looking for a Data Analyst Intern to support the Company with the following

duties:

• Data Collection, gather sales-related data from multiple retailer and other databases;

• Data owner for the business Activity ledger for promo sellout and incentives;

• Periodical sales report and Database management;

• Sales Strategy Support: collaborate with sales teams and leadership to provide data-driven

insights and recommendations for optimizing sales strategies, pricing strategies, product

offerings, and market positioning;

• Market insight analysis: stay updated on industry trends, competition benchmark, best

practices related to sales analytics.




Requirements:




· Bachelor Degree or Master Degree in Economics, Finance or related fields of study;

· Good knowledge of English Language;

. Good teamwork spirit;

. Excellent knowledge in Excel and strong affinity with mats and figures.

. Proactivity and problem solving capability is requested







Does it sound like you? Then send us your resume and we will be glad to speak to you!







This announcement is aimed at both sexes, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91 and to people of

all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Adlook is a leading ad tech company, pioneering in programmatic advertising with our cutting-edge technology. As part of the RTB House group with over 1500 employees globally, we focus on innovative and future-proof solutions. By becoming a part of Adlook, you'll be entrusted with analytical responsibilities spanning diverse global markets. Your contributions will extend to large-scale projects focused on leveraging data to enhance performance understanding and streamline internal processes through automation. This role holds pivotal importance in an environment where success hinges on delivering precise insights and grasping critical performance metrics, particularly as Adlook undergoes substantial growth. Responsibilities:


Utilize SQL and/or Python to perform in-depth analysis using databases like Google Big Query
Assist local teams in achieving outstanding outcomes by offering insights and recommendations
Design, execute, and report on A/B testing and Brand Lift studies
Develop and maintain customized reporting and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar platforms
Collaborate closely with Sales and Platform Managers to deliver exceptional Analytics service to clients
Aid Sales in establishing test protocols for client projects
Conduct meta-analysis across campaigns to extract insights regarding campaign performance and user behavior
Propose and implement processes to enhance the efficiency of internal workflows



Requirements:


1-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in roles involving data analytics, focused on deriving insights and generating reports from real-world data
Proficiency in technical skills, including intermediate-level SQL and/or basic-intermediate Python coding necessary for data analysis. Proficiency in SQL is essential for utilizing BigQuery effectively
Ability to frame unstructured problems using available data, coupled with skills in visualizing and communicating results. Proficiency in traditional office applications like Excel and PowerPoint (or their Google Suite equivalents) is required
Understanding of basic statistics and hypothesis testing, including A/B testing and statistical significance
Familiarity with online media and/or e-commerce, encompassing expertise in web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe), digital media sales models (CPM, CPC, CPA), and analysis of on-site user behavior
Fluent in English with the ability to present findings in a pedagogue manner
Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field (or non-quantitative field with significant quantitative experience). A Master’s Degree or certifications in analytics, data science, or digital media/marketing are advantageous but not mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, or Looker Studio
Location- Poland



Why Adlook:


Be part of a company shaping the future of digital marketing
Impactful role in a strategic entity of the Adlook group
Flexible working arrangements
Exposure to a fast-paced and growing online advertising sector
Work in a truly international environment with a dynamic, open-minded team



What We Offer:


Ability to join a young and fast-growing global organization with offices across EMEA, US and LATAM
You will get to work with amazing people in one of the fastest growing sectors in online advertising
Opportunity to work in a truly international environment
Friendly atmosphere while working with a dynamic team of open minded professionals with passion for internet technology and advertising solutions
Opportunities for professional growth
Competitive compensation and benefits

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Aluxion we are looking for a highly skilled Data Analyst to join us on a project in the pharmaceutical industry and play a pivotal role in data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for discovering insights from data.

Responsibilities


Ensure the Data Vault architecture aligns with business requirements and best practices in the pharma industry
Develop and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models
Good understanding of business processes in Pharma Technical Operations area and pharmaceutical supply chain models
Project Management: Lead project planning, scheduling, and execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery
Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop and maintain data models, write efficient SQL queries, and design and maintain cloud data warehouses
Performance Analysis: Track and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) such as CPA, CLV, ROAS, conversion rates, and customer segmentation
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker to communicate insights effectively


Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analysis and project management
Experience with Data Vault modeling
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in cloud data warehousing platforms
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Experience in the pharma industry
100% remote job


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with Python programming language
Knowledge of marketing analytics and attribution modeling


If you are a data-driven individual with a passion for uncovering insights and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply!

https://airtable.com/appqZ9UcJmJVegUgx/shrF6n1d0MIG2fHFp

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HICX is a leading worldwide provider of enterprise SaaS solutions for digital supplier management. Learn more about HICX

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our fast-growing Implementation Team.

The role will give you a lot of exposure and interaction directly with the customer, build up know-how around Enterprise systems and integrations. You will work with some of the world's leading organisations (EDF Energy, BAE Systems, Novartis, Mondelez, etc.) with HICX on some of the most challenging projects. 

Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources using SQL, Java, Python, and other tools
Create and maintain ETL scripts to handle data transformations for data migration and integration
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders
Prepare customized reports and dashboards using analytical tools to facilitate effective decision making
Work with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and develop recommendations based on data analysis
Collaborate with other team members to ensure data accuracy and consistency across various systems and tools
Engage in application surveillance and monitoring and reacting appropriately under SLAs
Assist with ad-hoc data analysis requests as needed by the business



Requirements



Essential{{:}}

2 years+ experience in a data analysis role in Procurement, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, or a related field
Proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in Excel including vlookups and pivot tables
Experience using data analysis tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience with data visualization and dashboard development
Strong analytical skills and ability to use data to inform decision-making
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in spoken and written English
CV must be in English

Desirable{{:}}

Experience with JSON, XML, SOAP, REST technologies
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data model design
Experience with ERP and SaaS platforms (SAP, Oracle, Infor M3, Coupa)
Experience in a programming language such as Java, Python, C# or .NET
Experience in applied analytics and Machine learning/AI techniques
Certifications in data analysis, SQL, or related fields are a plus




You'll love this role if...

You're excited about the prospect of working with Supplier Data in the Procurement and Supply Chain domain
You're passionate about analyzing data and drawing insights that will impact business decisions
You enjoy solving problems and don't mind going through multiple iterations until you get the best solution possible
You thrive in a continuous learning environment and keep up to date with the latest trends in your field
You're excited about learning from multiple industries and practices as you work through different data domains




You may not like this role if...

You like working independently as much as possible and don't like deadlines - this role requires that you collaborate in cross-functional teams to deliver work across one or more projects to satisfy clients and stakeholders
You are not interested with interacting with business stakeholders - the ability to understand the business context is key to this role as you will not only need to navigate the data but also know how to prepare the data in such a way that can be used by the business for analysis and insight
You expect clear instructions to perform your role - as a data analyst, you may often need to perform your role with limited context and information, and you will need to be open to seeking this out and iterating through multiple solutions
You do not like going through the process of cleaning and transforming - data analysts know the reality of how much work needs to be put in to get data to a readily available state and you need to be ready to take on that challenge
You do not like debugging SQL queries or find the prospect of seeing large pieces of code scary - to be able to confidently triage, investigate, and resolve issues effectively, debugging is a core part in a data analyst's workstream.



Benefits


Work from anywhere in Romania - we are a fully remote company.
Flexible PTO - We offer 25 days of paid holiday per year + 3 Public Holidays.
Connect and socialize with the team during our company socials and off-site events.
We celebrate special occasions with you - like your birthday! Additional PTO for all employees during their birthdays.
Receive Competitive Pay - Our team makes sure to provide a highly competitive rate based on your skills and location.
Work with a diverse, international team.
Tons of amazing career opportunities in a fast-growing in demand industry.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Per seria e prestigiosa società di consulenza, attiva da molti anni nei servizi per la P.A., ricerchiamo un/una Junior Data Analyst. Si richiede il possesso di un diploma di laurea ad indirizzo umanistico o scientifico. La persona si occuperà del trattamento di dati in termini di inserimento, elaborazione, analisi, reportistica. Assisterà inoltre gli utenti per problematiche inerenti i dati in archivio. Si richiede un forte interesse per l'analisi dati e per il settore ICT, un buon orientamento al lavoro e ottime competenze relazionali. E' inoltre richiesto un ottimo utilizzo del pacchetto Office. Costituirà requisito preferenziale la conoscenza di uno o più sistemi di BI. La mansione prevede trasferte su tutto il territorio nazionale. L'Azienda propone un contratto di apprendistato della durata di 36 mesi con prospettive di crescita. La sede di lavoro è a Montevarchi.

Settore: Studi professionali e di consulenza

Ruolo: Altro

Anni di esperienza: < 1 anno

Tipo di occupazione: Apprendistato

Inquadramento: Studente/Stage

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Financial Services




We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst with a strong background in SQL, R, Python and Power BI to join a growing financial services organisation on a permanent basis.




The role will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insights, generating reports and developing visual dashboards to support business operations and strategic initiatives.




The ideal candidate will possess the ability to gather, analyse and interpret large datasets to support data driven decision-making processes.




The Role




Extract, clean, and manage large datasets from various data sources using SQL, R and Python.
Design and maintain efficient databases, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Work with the wider business teams to define data needs and requirements.
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, patterns and insights.
Use statistical methods and machine learning algorithms in R and Python to analyse data and forecast trends.
Design, build, and maintain data models to support reporting and analysis needs.
Create interactive and dynamic reports and dashboards using Power BI to present insights to stakeholders.
Translate complex data into easy-to-understand visualisations and presentations.
Monitor and maintain existing dashboards, ensuring accuracy and timely updates.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business challenges and provide actionable insights based on data analysis.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation using data insights.
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and concise manner.




The Person




Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science or a related field.
6 years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases and manipulating large datasets.
Experience in R and Python for statistical analysis, machine learning and automation tasks.
Strong knowledge of Power BI for creating dashboards and data visualisations.
Familiarity with other data visualisation tools like Tableau or Excel.
Hands-on experience with database design, data warehousing and ETL processes.
Strong statistical and data modelling skills.
Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical mindset.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.




Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Show more

  • Strong statistical and data modelling skills.
  • Ability to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical mindset.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.


Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Analista de datos (PowerBI)
Description:
¿Estás preparado para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas…




🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸




Somos una empresa internacional con más de 16 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática.




Con más de 3000 Primers operando en 5 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Energía, Infraestructuras y Marketing Digital.




Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo:




ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL




🕵🏽‍♂️ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍♂️




Al menos 2 años de experiencia en el desarrollo y diseño de soluciones utilizando Power BI.
Experiencia en PowerBI, incluida la creación de informes y cuadros de mando desde cero (mucho énfasis en diseño de los mismos)
Fuerte capacidad para escribir fórmulas DAX avanzadas para cálculos personalizados.
Experiencia en el diseño de modelos de datos eficientes y relaciones entre tablas.
Valorable: conocimiento en Microsoft Fabric o Python
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación en castellano e inglés (mucha comunicación será con clientes internacionales) y capacidad para conceptualizar las necesidades del cliente.




¡Y lo más importante de todo, que realmente estés motivado para un cambio!




🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀




Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos

un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad?




Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura:




· Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado.

· Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día.

· Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad.

· No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial.




¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!!!




¡Te esperamos!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Shiji Group is a major software supplier in the hospitality and retail industries. Developing worldwide leading products and technologies, aimed at the international market and speeding up its globalization progress. Our team of more than 5,000 talented employees, in 70+ subsidiaries worldwide, is constantly adapting to facilitate the transition to fully integrated systems for our clients through a network of secure, scalable, and ready for the future platforms, so clients can focus on their core competencies of serving their customer and guests.




Job Description



We are expanding our team, and are currently looking for a proactive and detail oriented Data Analyst, to contribute to our international growth. The ideal candidate will have experience with data analysis and management, be comfortable with technology / SaaS Business Intelligence Tools, and is motivated by the opportunity to develop new ways to ensure a 100% data delivery & quality with the least effort possible.





Reporting to the Director of Product & Operations, the responsibilities include:


Perform data analysis and special reports for key clients, marketing and sales to identify data-driven trends and understand what matters and why.
Prepare excellent presentations, and consultancy documents to be delivered to clients.
Prioritize projects and the special data reporting pipeline and delivery times.
Execute, build and maintain data projects using Python, Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio and some other data analysis tools like SPSS.
Structure, organize and maintain masses of information from different DBs to efficiently deliver on time the projects in pipeline.
Collaborate with the product managers to develop new visualizations, CRM data analysis and special data projects.


Qualifications



Candidates must be motivated, proactive and responsible individuals with:


Highly analytical mind.
Advanced Excel user.
Advanced Python user.
Experience managing the main Business Intelligence tool (Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Experience with advanced statistical methodology with knowledge in Python.
Desirable Knowledge in managing data through MySQL and API connections.
Results oriented.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work well under pressure and manage their own time to deliver the Task / Projects.
Desirable knowledge in the Hotels sector and online reputation.




Requirements:


Excellent level of English. (Spanish desired).
Degree or being studying information technology, business administration, engineering or mathematical sciences.


Additional Information


Flexible work schedule
Free coffee, tea, and afterwork drinks
Brand new office located in the center of Barcelona
International team and fantastic work environment
Team building activities and charity donation programs
Discounts on Private health insurance, ticket restaurant, transport, kindergarten

Title: Analista (m/h/x) de datos junior (Excel, SQL y PowerBi)
Description:
¿Te consideras una persona analítica? ¿Te gusta trabajar con datos? ¿Buscas un nuevo proyecto en un ambiente favorable y motivador en una empresa líder en el sector energético? Si tu respuesta es afirmativa, ¡continúa leyendo!

MANPOWERGROUP incorpora perfil Técnico (m/h/x) análisis de datos y reporting para una importante empresa del sector energético.

¿QUÉ HARÁS?

Refuerzo actividad en el envío de ofertas a Sistemas. Soporte al equipo B2CPyP en la actividad de B2C

Refuerzo actividad de ofertas a Sistemas:

Apoyo en el cálculo de precios para las ofertas de B2C
Preparación de plantillas con el detalle de las ofertas a cargar en Sistemas
Revisión correcta implantación de las ofertas en Sistemas

Soporte actividad B2C:

Soporte en la elaboración de las ofertas para B2C
Preparación de informes de seguimiento de contratación
Apoyo en la interlocución con el Área de Marketing




¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?

· Contrato: indefinido a través de Manpower

· Jornada completa

· Horario: L – V de 9h-18h

· Salario 26.000€ b/a

· Zona: Madrid

REQUISITOS:

Grado / Licenciatura en Empresariales, Economía, Matemáticas, Administración de Empresas; Ingeniería Industrial, de la Energía o Informática. Valorables otras titulaciones si cumplen con todos los requisitos de conocimiento y experiencia.




Se valorará conocimiento en el sector energético, mercados eléctricos y formación del precio de la energía.




Nivel avanzado en paquete Office, especialmente de Excel.

Conocimiento básico de bases de datos (elaboración de consultas sencillas en SQL).

Se valorarán conocimientos en PowerBI.

Persona con carácter comunicativo y abierto.




Si estás en búsqueda y cuentas con experiencia ¡no dudes en inscribirte! BUSCAMOS EL TALENTO Y LA MOTIVACIÓN ¡TE BUSCAMOS A TI!
